forkee.name: pfatt
forkee.description: Enable true bridge mode for AT&T U-Verse and pfSense (this is a fork of an original repository https://github.com/aus/pfatt. Since it is not available anymore, I'll do my best to maintain a copy for people that still need a bypass)

forkee.name: cargo-about
forkee.description: 📜 Cargo plugin to generate list of all licenses for a crate 🦀

issue.title: Add PositionEncodingKind and friends from 3.17
issue.body: 3.17 introduces `PositionEncodingKind` to indicate how positions are encoded (utf-8, utf-16, or utf-32).  There are also corresponding fields in the client (`positionEncodings`) and server (`positionEncoding`) capabilities to negotiate which to use.

comment.body: hey @Marwes hate to do the ping here, but is there anything else this PR needs?

issue.title: GCS5: Sheet no longer shows multiple pages on single display if there is room
issue.body:
On previous Versions, if there was room on the screen, the sheet would show multiple pages
now it does not
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19297623/192527344-fdde3c80-3785-44dc-9389-c1abeaefa8cb.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19297623/192527472-d89b3acc-0d40-47f5-8c9e-3903ecbe427a.png)

comment.body: ditto here, I've got multiple monitors, and tend to just shove my character sheet on a side monitor while playing, and it was nice to not have to scroll around a bunch.  IDK if this would make it easier (haven't gotten to look at the code much yet), but, at least for me, less complicated "splitting" where entire sections just shift over would likely still be helpful (e.g. the whole "trait/skill chunk" goes to a page, or the whole "notes" section goes to a page).  Alternatively, while likely more complicated, allowing users to manually split into another tab or something would also solve my usecase.

commits.message: 139 - Fix prev_sibling to actually return the previous sibling instead of another node before it

Merge pull request #140 from MalteJanz/139/fix-prev-sibling-function

#139 - Fix prev_sibling to actually return the previous sibling
142 - Fix panic on prev_sibling call when called on Root SyntaxNode

[tmp] remove the ord requirement

It doesn't seem to be used, waiting on maintainers to see if there's an
explanation.
